attributes.action: Introduce compulsory voter registration to the National Curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that 8 million eligible voters in the UK are not registered. Turnout among the 18-25 age bracket is low. We can increase democratic participation by registering school students and explaining the mechanics of local and national elections. 

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2019/may/01/eight-million-eligible-uk-voters-not-registered-ahead-of-european-elections-study-finds

There are many charities and organisations in the UK that can support schools to get ready for this.
attributes.background:
Students in UK schools leave at 18 without any formal instruction on how to register to vote.
In a modern democracy where we promote democratic values in schools through the British Values agenda we should ensure that our citizens do not turn 18 without being registered to vote.
